DataElement.preferredName: Post Procedure Analgesic Agent Prescription Recommendation Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field of the name related to doctor's orders for medicine advice of analgesic agent (pain alleviating compounds) after procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Post Procedure Analgesic Agent Prescription Recommendation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to doctor's orders for medicine advice of analgesic agent (pain alleviating compounds) after procedure.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.:A particular course of action intended to achieve a result.:Drugs that reduce pain. These drugs include aspirin, acetaminophen, and ibuprofen.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

Compounds that alleviate pain without loss of consciousness.  Analgesics act by various mechanisms including binding with opioid receptors and decreasing inflammation.  Choice of analgesic may be determined by the type of pain.  These compounds include opioid, non-opioid and adjuvant analgesic agents.

Property.preferredDefinition: A doctor's order for medicine or another intervention.:Recommendation; advice telling someone what the best thing to do is.

Concepts.definition: A verbal or written order given by an authorized person instructing a patient to obtain and use a medical device, prescription or undergo a procedure.
Advice telling someone what the best thing to do is.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free-text field fo the name of the pain medication prescribed or taken.
